column30: Good value, with trade-offs, on Fuji x100
column31:
When I used it with my basic Canon point and shoot, as well as a Canon T2i, it was quite fast and kept up with me when shooting RAW files. However, using it on my Fuji x100 was a different experience. Canon's processors are probably more efficient than Fuji, but I found myself waiting for the buffer to complete more often when using this card on the x100. It wasn't a huge inconvenience, and for a casual day of shooting with RAW files and movies, it definitely did its job. However, when I took my camera out to my kids' field trip, I did miss a few potential shots because of the buffer. Additionally, transferring files to the computer was also quite the wait. Now, I bought a 32GB card and like most people, I bought it with the intention of making full use of its capacity. But after a morning shoot, I transferred around 4GB of files to my computer and found it quite slow, which made me rethink about using the card all the way to its limit. Perhaps I just got used to the speeds of my CompactFlash cards that I use on my 5D, but I expected a bit more of the read speed of this card.Overall, for the price, you really can't go wrong with it and it will serve the needs of most consumers with entry level cameras. But, if you own more demanding equipment or require faster write speeds, grab a UHS-1 card. If you're paying around a thousand dollars for photo gear, you may as well get the fastest card you can get. I'm going to keep this as a backup card or relegate it to my Canon cameras, but I think I'll be shopping around for a UHS-1 card for my x100."

I have a canon rebel T3I, and the manual indicates I need a at least class 6 sd card for video, so I got Transcend class 10 and thinking it would be fast enough, but I was wrong. I was confused and went to a local camera store asking for help, but they weren't helpful on solving this issue. Then I went to bestbuy, gladly there was a salesman that knows exactly what the issue was, and suggested me to SanDisk 45MB/s extreme pro. According to him, you need at least a 30mb/s card for video recording. Transcend class 10 only offers up to 20 MB/s, that's why I was seeing pauses in video shooting. I have got SanDisk 45MB/s extreme, and so far it has been great with HD videos! Highly suggested if you need HD video like I do.But if you all you need is still pictures, and 640 videos, this transcend class 10 card is very affordable and does a great job!"

column180: Fast card from reliable but cheap company, works well in my Canon 60D
column181:
This card is performing well after several months heavy use in my Canon 60D, and consistently writes faster than its Class-10 SD rating.I've typically viewed Transcend as a budget brand, but have had good luck with several of their SDHC cards, using them in various Canon cameras.  I would prefer premium Sandisk SDHCs, with their reputation for high-performance and high-reliability, but the realities of budget and bang-for-the-buck have repeatedly steered me to Transcend.I tested write speeds on this card, with a Transcend USB2 SD card reader (plugged directly into a PC USB port to eliminate the slowdown of an intermediate hub), writing raw blocks continuously.The card wrote continuously at about 18.5-19MB/sec (512K blocks), with performance decreasing modestly to 17.5-18MB/sec for smaller 32K blocks.  I didn't test read speeds, but with these write numbers (writing is always slower), the card should easily meet the 10MB/sec requirement for Class-10.  Indeed, at nearly 20MB/sec, the bottleneck is more likely going to be the device using the card, than the card itself.Recommended."

I haven't had any corruption writeability issues, and it seems well made.However, when recording 1080p footage, speed issues have occasionally been a problem. I reformat the card every time I dump it, but nonetheless, occasionally I'll get the dreaded meter-of-doom on my screen, and it'll stop recording. Messing with the Qscale settings on Magic Lantern could probably alleviate the problem if need be, but I prefer running in standard compression. It doesn't happen often enough to be a big issue, but I'll probably be getting a different set of cards next time I purchase. For a someone who shoots event video or needs absolute reliability, I can see this being a big problem.Overall, I'm fairly happy, but speed issues still make me shudder."

I buy Transcend SDHC Flash Memory Cards fairly regularly for video and photos. I had a video shoot with a model who was in town for a week from Australia. I bought 2 new Transcend cards and loaded them up in my cameras. After the shoot I get an error message on my Canon camcorder that I'd never seen before about the card. I took it out and hoped for the best. after the model left, I tried loading the video on my computer. No go. The card wouldn't recognize. I spent two days reading forums about fixing SDHC cards. I tried everything. I downloaded software. I spent $108 on Data Rescue 3. I spent $50 to update Disc Warrior. Nothing worked. Money spent, along with the $300 model fee.Today, I get and email from Amazon saying, 'Due to a manufacture process issue, the item subjected to this recall might cause read/write blocking if the file size is over 4GB and the information on the card may not transfer.' After almost two seeks of struggling, now I know what went wrong. Goodbye, shoot.I'm so disappointed in Transcend. I wonder how many other one-time shoots have been ruined."

The Class 10 SD card's transfer speed is unlike that of any other SD card I've used before, I love it! Videos taken on cameras come out smoother because the card can save frames fast enough that none of them need to be dropped to continue writing the video to the card. Take Photos faster and transfer data faster to your card. This is the real deal when it comes to memory, if only I had bought a 32gig!"
20110825"
column259:
Do not buy anthing from onSale.They're gonna hold your money for 5 days and cancel your order without any reaction.There are so many good business men except onSale.It's serious. Check about onSale in Amazon.It's true."
20110825"
column261: Its alright definitely not a class 10
column262:
For Photography, this card does alright, for HD 1080p video its poor.The first card i got failed and i lost all my data on it, i used it maybe three times and not much.The second one, which i got free becAuse it broke so soon works. However, when im taking hd video it has some pixelation/scrambling. As if it is not writing fast enough. Now this is SUPPOSEDLY a class 10. But my class 6 works better than this one does. Transfer rate is pretty slow even when i have it plugged into my computer compared to my class 6 and 8.Im kind of disappointed but it is inexpensive, and its 16gb! so cant really go wrong there.bottom line, if your just shooting casually it should be ok, if your a professional, or shoot alot of HD and want crisp clean reliable images, skip this and get a better one."
20110825"
column265:
really fast sd card for your dslr. i have the 16gb and 8gb version and couldnt be happier with them paired with my nikon d3100."
20110825"
column268:
They are economical, durable, easy to use and great quality. I am very pleased with this investment. Therefore highly recommend the entire community in the world Amazon."
20110825"
column271:
these cards are a great product for the money,now when I check my trail cams I can leave them in the woods instead of bringing camera back untill I get the time to review pics"

column274:
I've bought several of these for use in my Nikon D7000 DSLR camera.  Fast, easy, no problems.  I assume any problems with lag on storage on the camera is due to storing RAW images while shooting continuous drive, 10+ photos."

column277:
Good value for capacity/price/and 'Speed' which i'm not concern about as many other's maybe.I use then to send  to my Friend's with some goodies on them. Like i said for the Price youcan't beat that ...I'm just on my second card , which came damage in the mail , But Amazon had a replacement in my mail box with-in 5 days , and i'm sure that my return card was not even received yet ... Go Amazon ...... There G r e a t ! ! ! *****"

column280:
Fantastic card for a great price. I've yet to have problems with it, and considering the sort of product it is, I'll doubt I will in the near-to-distant future.Once you take the price into account, it's not hard to make the decision to buy."
20110824"
column283:
i have upgraded to the 8gb card on my digital camera..it works great..the transfer speed is better than my previous one. and holds a lot more pictures..if you are in the market for a 8gb memory card at a good price than this is the one for you."

column286:
No worries. I'm using as a portable file for all sorts of audio and video files. I swap beteen work and personal commuters."
20110823"

I got this last week and took it on a trip to New York yesterday, and about 15% of the photo files were corrupt. This is horrendous. Looking at the reviews (and not sampling in any real sense), it seems like a number new owners are having exactly this problem this month."
20110823"
column292:

I ended up with 2800+ photos, every single one of them captured and saved with no issues."

column295:
This product has not disappointed me yet and has proven to meet my needs as expected. I am very satisfied with the product. The delivery was on time and packaged well."

column297: Great Flash Memory For The Price

Works great for HD video capture (720p @ 60 fps) using a Kodak PlaySport. I have not run into any issues with write speed on the card. Great capacity for the price. I inadvertently opened the camera under water and all of our vacation pics/videos are still safe on the chip despite getting wet."

I purchased this specifically for my Nikon D3100, and so far it's worked perfectly for both photos, and 1080p video.  I think it's a great value for the capacity!"

Great Card for my Canon M30 video camera.  The Camera regognized the space and the speed.The only problem is I don't have enough to film to fill the card up?"

I use this on my canon t3i , but the annoying thing is that the recording will stop suddenly in a middle of the shoot , the clip will be there , but that is very annoying if you are in a middle of an interview , I formatted it many times and the problem still occurs ."
20110821"
column309: Fast and all the space I can use
column310:
I bought this to use for making street videos with my Panasonic Lumix GF1 Micro Four Thirds. I am delighted and now will probably get one for my Nikon D7000. Unless I go for even bigger. In video, size matters."

column313:
The card performs quite well.  I just got a new caamera and wanted to ensure I could use the camera to its fullest.  The card is very responsive even when I am running the camera very fast for a sports shot."
20110820"
column316:
I would normally not waste my time reviewing something that already has 900+ reviews.  But I just wanted to point out that recently, I accidentally left one of these cards in my pocket through a wash cycle.  This card survived a half-hour being agitated in soapy water and then 150+ degree heat for an hour.  The card has been working flawlessly for 3 weeks since the incident.Great card."
20110820"
column319:
Having at least an 8GB SD card for my camera is a must because I shoot HD movies that gobble-up a lot of memory. This price of this card beat the big box store by a substantial amount and Amazon delivery is so fast that it makes you feel like they're just around the block. Great purchase!"
20110819"
column322:
It's hard to review a memory card, particularly when I don't buy many (this is my second one in 3 years, I believe). Memory per dollar good, I have had no issues with the card. I use it on my Panasonic TM-90K video camera and it keeps up flawlessly."
20110819"
column325:
The product arrived quickly. It was recognized by my Toshiba Thrive immediately. No problem moving all my eBooks to the SD card and retrieving it was a cinch. Initially, I was hoping I can move some of my apps to the SD card. It turns out that Android OS (Honeycomb) can't do that. Just a little disappointed. All in all, I am pretty happy with the SD card."
20110819"
column328:
Just got this for my Canon S95 and have found it to be an excellent card. Obviously as a class 10, its capabilities for transfer outstrip the camera, but I did not want it to be the rate limiting step. No complaints so far"
20110819"
column330: Quick for the amount of memory
column331:
I never have to worry about a 'Busy' light on my camera between taking shots, even though I'm taking RAW format images -- and I can take thousands. This is exactly what I wanted in my SDHC card, and that's exactly what it's providing.It's hard to review items like this, because you tend to forget about them unless something goes wrong. I've taken hundreds of pictures and downloaded them to my computer, and they transfer quickly enough -- the read speed isn't fantastic, but it's fairly quick. The write speed is just fantastic, though."
20110819"
column334:
I purchased this to have some backup memory for my Canon EOS Rebel T2i as well as my Kodak Sport C123 on a trip to Hawaii.  I was concerned after reading some of the negative feedback, but it worked wonderfully on the trip and I have used it often since then and still no problems at all.  I mainly use it for still photography, but have also used it for video and have been very pleased.A SanDisk 4GB Class 6 card came with the Canon and I can definitely tell a difference between the two cards.  The Transcend is much faster and drastically better quality for shooting video in both the nice Canon DSLR and the cheap little point & shoot Kodak Sport.  I've been very happy with it and you can't beat Amazon's price!"
20110818"
column337:
I bought two of these and they both failed on first use. I'll never buy a Transcend card again. I hear s-a-n-d-i-s-k is much better."
20110818"
column339: Worked for one day, then corrupted
column340:
Worked in my camcorder, HDC-TM90 for one day, then the camcorder locked up.  I shut it down and tried to use the card, the camcorder said 'check card'.  Tried to read on a PC, the PC asked to format it, then couldn't.  Listed it as 1GB instead of 16GB, but still couldn't format it.  Tried to use Transcends repair software, it couldn't read it either.  Transcend's formatter couldn't format it.  Emailed Transcend, they emailed back card was defective.  I lost video that I can't replace, very disappointed.  I would avoid this product."
20110817"
column342: Great memory card at a great price!
column343:
I use this with my DSLR (T3i) and it works perfect, I use it mostly for HD 1080p videos and I get a good 40-45 mins of video. Transfer speeds are great and when taking pictures the card is speedy and keeps up with continious shooting. Amazing deal for the price!"
20110817"
column346:
4 out of 6 videos ruined by corrupt playback. Also, the speed ratings test a little more than my ScanDisk 4 card, but not by much, using HDTune. Not sure how valid these tests are obviously in my case.I have no issues with my ScanDisk 4 card. This works flawlessly in new ELPH 300 with no issues with several 720P movies.Oh well, at least some of you did well with the cheap card.  Thanks to Amazon for easy returns!"
20110817"
column348: It works for pictures, video, and sound recording.
column349:
I use this card in a sound recorder, HD video camera, and a DSLR camera.  Works great.  No problems. It has held up to frequent removal and one washing in the washing machine.  I have bought six of these."
20110817"
column351: WASTE OF MONEY FOR VIDEO PEOPLE
column352:
READ CAREFULLY. I bought a Canon 60D and it said it needed an SDHC Memory class 6 or higher. This one is supposed to be class 10. Well Canon users, it doesn't work! Don't even try recording video with it, and automatic message will appear 'Movie Recording Stopped Automatically'. So, Don't waste 50 bucks, put another 50 and buy a SanDisk Card. A Real Card."
20110816"
column355:
I bought this to replace a class 4 SDHC card which was also 8 GB. If I didn't have another camera to use the old card in I wouldn't have bothered. I use this one in my DLSR camera and it makes a noticeable difference when taking continuous raw or raw + jpeg shots. It also seems to load faster when browsing through pictures on my camera or computer and transfer to the computer faster. When I bought it it was only 50 cents more than the class 6 version and definitely a great price. I have only had it for 2 weeks so I can't comment on the lifetime of the card."
20110816"
column358:
Installed this memory card in my Cannon PowerShot SX30is, formatted it per the camera instructions and began taking pictures and videos.  While I was taking my first batch of pictures several of them, on playback, were labeled as an 'Unidentified image' which could not be down loaded to my computer.  Then a few days later, all of my pictures and videos disappeared after an error message came up on the camera screen that I had a 'memory card failure'.  Do not buy this brand of memory card....go with a known quality company like SanDisk."
20110815"
column361:
Ordered this for a honeymoon vacation in Europe.. Everything seemed to work well, that is until we got home last night. As soon as we plugged the SD card into the computer, it asked us to initialize the card as it was unreadable! When putting the SD card back into the camera, it gave the terrifying MEMORY CARD error! We are currently running a data recovery software to hopefully recover our priceless images. Buying reliable Sandisk card this weekend!"
20120502"
column363: No HD Video with Canon t3i
column364:
I bought this card with a new Canon T3i. Unfortunately I have found that it will not record HD video for more than a few seconds. After that the camera buffer overflow icon comes on and the camera stops recording. I have tried re-formatting but it did not help. Even worse is Amazon's return policy only allows for 30-day returns, but I did not try this kind of recording until after 31 days. I do not recommend this manufacturer."
20120502"
column367:
I always get my orders quickly and this was no exception.  I use this card in my Panasonic LX-5 digital camera and record a lot of video, as well as still pictures; it works very well.  It writes fast and the Transcend,class 10 hasn't failed me yet.  I do highly recommend this product to anyone who do a lot of photography and video and wants quality."

column370:
it is sooooooo great! when i use this i can have more picture in my camera!!if i need one more ! i'll buy in here!thank you for fast delivery!~"

I haven't had any problems yet."

column396: Picked Up A Few - Love Them

I needed to buy some memory cards for my new Nikon d5100 and based on the price and reviews, these couldn't be beat.I've shot probably 3,000 pictures on these cards and haven't had any issues with corrupted date or format issues.  They are fast enough to keep up with the camera but might bottleneck if I had a more expensive camera with higher burst framerate.I would recommend picking up 2 of these insted of a single 32gb as that way if the camera gets stolen/set on fire, you still have half of your pictures.Love these cards."

No problem with video recording and I could say that it is a lot faster than my Kingston class 4 memory as it can go up to 26 shots in sports mode before it slows down compare to 12 on my old class 4 memory. Is it really a class 10? I'm not sure but I don't know but it performs well on my T3i."

column405: DOA on Macbook Pro and two cameras.
column406:
Tried in my Macbook Pro.  Didn't mount.  Tried it in my Canon Powershot, it said 'card locked!'  It wasn't.  Tried it in my Kodak Playsport, I got the '!' error.  Wouldn't format in either camera.  Result, this thing's a piece of poopy."

Purchased this card as well as a SanDisk Class 4 card..there is no comparison between the two! The Class 10 is fast and very reliable in both taking the photos you want, and it works just as well when downloading to your PC..the class 4 on the other hand..sooo slowww!!For practically the same price, this is a no brainer!5 stars across the board for an excellent product."

column417: Great value- works great with all my HDSLR's

I recommend getting these cards (and will be getting a few more shortly), but don't go for a 16GB get 2 8GB cards. Same price and it makes more sense to carry around 2 different cards just in case your data gets lost- unless you're using it for an HD cam and don't want to switch out the cards."

Using it for video and photo, so far it's amazing. No problems. I hear I could get longer photo bursts with a higher class card but class ten is plenty for HD video, and is good for raw photo bursts, I have to wait every once in a while for buffering to the card, but for the price it can't be beat, or at least couldn't at the time, I've had it at least a year."

I bought the 16 GB memory card because of its size and low price. This is a great memory card."

Based on the 1st batch of Transcend 16GB cards and a Sony EX1R (Firmware 1.0) purchased about a year ago, we purchased these cards when we obtained two new EX1Rs.Problems were immediate with the new camera/firmware combination.  I can't blame the problems solely on the cards, but be warned."

column432: Corrupted straight out of the package

Never took a single pic or video with this card because right out of the box I got an error message on my camera that the card was unusable.  The computer doesn't recognize it when it's plugged in the card reader, either."
20110811"
column435: Throw out your other SD cards, this one is the only one you'll need!
column436:
As a film maker, I carry around many SD cards. 2gb, 8gb, all sorts of sizes. After a while I'd fill up one card, take it out and swap in another. This became increasingly annoying, and caused me to misplace an SD card. I recently decided to buy this one, in hopes to replace all of my others.Having said that, this thing is amazing. At 32gbs and a Class 10, this card is the only one that you will need. I went from taking 3 pictures in 2 seconds, all the way up to 60 pictures in 10 seconds. The best part is, I only have to take it out when I get back to my computer at home because, it writes at unbelievably fast speeds, can hold hundreds of photos, and stores hours of HD footage.I highly recommend this SD card on all accounts. Affordability, Storage, Speed and Convenience!"
20110810"
column439:
I bought this for my Panasonic camcorder. Works perfectly fine and records 1080P (highest quality) without any issues. Play back is also as expected."
20110810"
column442:
I haven't tested this in any kind of depth, but it seems to be just as fast as every other class 10 SDHC card I've owned (if not faster). It takes video on the Canon T2i without any buffering problems."
20110810"
column445:
I bought two of these cards for my camera.  They worked as advertised.  I took several hundredpictures and dozens of videos by now. I had no problem saving them quickly. I'm satisfied."
20110810"
column448:
I bought two of these cads for my Nikon S9100.The good:After testing with h2testw.exe (google it!) I'm happy to report 16.3Mb/sec write and 19.1Mb/sec read average.The bad:I believe the contact terminals or the plastic on the card itself was slightly out of spec.  Both cards had an interference fit going into my camera and actually would not click into position OR release without the help of some small pliers.  After inserting and removing the card several times, the card (or my camera) had been 'clearanced' and  now works as expected without the use of pliers.Verdict:Great price and awesome performance outweigh the minor clearance issues."
20110809"
column451:
I have the panasonic lumix fz-100 camera and got this for it.  can hold 5000+ pictures in stunning 14.1 megapixels."
20110809"
column454:
Needed an SDHC card class 6 speed or better for a Nikon Point-and-Shoot camera. (If less than class 6, recorded 720i video appears jumpy.) Installed this card (actually class 10), the camera accepted it without needing any formatting, and I began shooting 720i that was as smooth as silk. Also noticed much faster file transfer to the computer, too. Haven't owned it long enough to rate durability and consistancy, but the price, speed, and functionality are five star."
20110809"
column457:
At first, I only ordered Sandisk memory because I've never had a problem with them and very dependable and thought I would try the Transcend for the extremely great value...no regrets!Recorded long movie clips without problem and speed is great!UPDATE 11/11:  Ordered the 32GB card and although the card works fantastic as expected, I didn't get a hard plastic case to store it."
20110809"
column460:
Pros: This card is great for continuous shots, and lots of them. It's also great for shooting in RAW format because of the high capacity at such a low price! Using a card reader, data transfers quickly (15-18Mbps if my memory is correct).Cons: I purchased this card with shooting 1080p video in mind. I own a Canon T3i and my current card was not cutting it. Apparently this card was not fast enough either to keep up with the video from my T3i because the buffer continuously 'ran out' and video recording was stopped automatically. It also appeared to be extremely conditional. Shooting indoors I could record for longer periods of time (around 5 mins), however... outdoors (standard mid-west 7:00 am conditions) the card performed poorly allowing a maximum recording time of 4 seconds at 1080p 30 fps.Summary: Maybe it's the Canon T3i, or maybe it's the Transcend 32GB SDHC card. If you own a Canon T3i and want to shoot video I do not recommend this product. If you don't care about video and just want to shoot photos than BUY IT, this card will be of great value to you!"
20110809"
column462: Cost Effective and Works like a dream.
column463:
All I know is that it does the job for my Olympus E-PL2. If I upgrade to a better DSLR I'll consider the Sandisk, but right now on a budget this is GREAT!"
20110809"
column466:
I bought the item to free up my laptop from all the music and pictures and it worked wonders for me."
20110809"
column469:
What can I say-it's a flash card. I bought it for my camcorder and needed the capacity for high def video. No issues with the product. However, they could have done better with the packaging. It came in a box 8 inches by 11 inches large. Wouldn't a bubble wrap envelope been enough?"
20110808"
column472:
Highly recommend this item. This is the 3rd sd I bought and I'm really happy with it. Good capacity ,good velocity and the best  of all a really good price for this item ."
20110808"
column475:
I don't have a good way to rate speed which is what a class 10 should be all about. It seems to record quickly enough in the burst mode of my T1i maybe faster than my old class 2 chip. Otherwise it seems to record as well as a chip should. So far, was a good buy."
20110808"
column477: Same speed as 4GB Class 4 Sandisk Extreme card
column478:
Got this mostly for the size, but was hoping for some better speed in my Nikon D7000 compared to the 4GB Sandisk Extreme Class 4 cards I already had. No difference, in fact in some cases the Sandisk cards are about a second faster.Here's what I did to test:Shoot 9 continuous shots (fills the buffer) with the camera set to 5fps, 14-bit RAW.As soon as the last shot completes, time how long it takes to clear the buffer (until a 9 appears in the viewfinder again indicating you can shoot 9 shots).After 5 runs apiece shooting the same subject and lighting conditions the Class 10 Transcend card and the Class 4 SanDisk card come in at exactly the same - around 11 seconds.I got this more for the storage, but if speed matters to you stick with one of the better brands like SanDisk."
20110808"
column481:
Wanted a big capacity card to use in a fast Canon camera. Haven't seen any shortcomings at all. Video works great too."
20110808"
column483: Works great with Olympus E-PL2 camera
column484:
This memory card offered the most storage I could find in the SDHC format. It's very fast and does a great job at taking multiple photographs in a row."
20110808"
column487:
I'm using it on my Nikon dSLR camera to shoot pictures and HD videos. I've been using for more than a month and I have found nothing to complain about it. Overall, this product is good and the price is reasonable. Don't bother to spend much more on different brand."
20110808"
column490:
I bought this card to go along with my HP HD camera. It worked seemlessly and I have not had an issue with it yet."
20110808"
column493:
I ordered this card for my camcorder that has no internal memory.  It works great.  Plenty of storage space so no need to download everything before going to another event where I want to use the camera again."
20110808"
column495: great card, rapid write times-timely delivery
column496:
The higher class cards really show their value when used to take video. In this case video with my point and shoot digital camera. The 'write time' with a class 10 is much so quicker than with 6 or 4 class cards. I did a bunch of online research before buying these cards and Transcend cards have a pretty good reputation for  not having glitches of lost sectors. So far not a single issue with them and good results with my photos and video. I highly recommend getting transcend class 10 cards as they are better than what you usually get at St*ples or your average consumer store, those stores usually offer class 4, maybe class 6. When they offer class 10 they usually charge a premium."
20110808"
column499:
Used these cards for two days in my Nikon D7000 and got format errors in the camera - lost everything on both cards. Computer does not recognize them, tried various recovery software with no success. If it really counts don't cheap out on your camera memory."
20110807"
column502:
Bought memory card for family trip. Card got corrupted on last day of vacation, lost all pictures for the trip and the card no longer works. Worked for 3 days out of the box and then died permanently."
20110806"
column505:
The picture saving speed after picture was taken is a little faster but not a whole lot.  For an armature photography like me I am happy with the current speed.  I knew there is other card out there which will give you supper fast.  If you have the buck, then go for that."
20110806"
column508:
didn't work .... like at all. computer does not even detect them, DSLR hates them ( it says they are to slow to record video) and NX5u runs them but half my footage was corrupt.really fast shipping though."
20110805"
column511:
TTTT transcend.  I decided to go with class 10 this time.  Formatted card in camera.  Shot first part of wedding fine, card worked great.  Until it became unreadable AND un-reformatable in camera and computer.  Lost all data.  Anyone know of a service that offers data recovery for cards that can't be re-formatted?I have a bunch of class 6 transcends that work great, never had a problem."
20110805"

They work great. They keep up with the 720P stream of video data my video camera throws at them and I've had no problems. The thing that I cannot say is how long they will last. So far so good though."

can take data as fast as my sony alpha can write it and holds more pictures than I can take."

column519: A pretty fast card. Great deal for the money.

However, I personally feel that the write speed is a little lacking when using it with my camera. (This could just be a camera issue.)It gets the job done, and it's cheap. What more could you ask for, other than a little more speed? I think it's definitely worth it."

column522: Great value and quality for price

column561: Perfect for Kodak Zi8 and Canon T1i
column562:
I've had the 16GB and 8GB class 10 cards from Transcend for several months now and have not run into a single issue with either on my Kodak Zi8 video camera or Canon T1i DSLR.  I've not done any real testing between this and other cards (I have quite a few Sandisk Extreme III cards in 2, 4 and 8GB capacities), but with extensive shooting of video and photos, I have yet to find anything to complain about.  For the price, these cards are really hard to beat.  I plan to purchase more.  Do note that if you are not shooting video, or using a DSLR and require high res images shot at maximum frames per second, a class 4 or class 6 card would suffice and probably save you money."
20110731"
column564: Fast enough for most of us--good value for the money
column565:
This 32GB card is a terrific accessory for a digital camera.  On my DS5100 Nikon DSLR this card allows for just shy of 1000 shots on the most profligate setting: where the camera is set to create one fine JPEG and one NEF (RAW) file per shot.  On other settings the user can store thousands of images on one of these cards.  No real need to bring a laptop or hard disk along on vacation any more.  One or two of these cards will safely and reliably store all the images that practically anyone will take on vacation.While there are faster SD cards out there, most users will not need more speed than this card provides.  Certain professionals, who blast out twenty or thirty shots at a time at say, 8 frames-per-second, may benefit from a faster card.  But usually the SD card is not the limiting factor in fast-frame shooting, so most users do not need a faster card.I have been using this card in my Nikon D5100 and it has been a real pleasure to use.  Two of these cards and I am ready for anything.  Highly recommended.  RJB."

column579: Best Card Yet for Canon T2i/550d Video
column580:
I've been using my Canon T2i DSLR with the popular 'Magic Lantern' software and have been looking for an SDHC card that would let me get the most out of my camera.  I figured an SD card is an SD card is an SD card (right?) - Well, apparently not...  Not all Class 10 SDHC cards are created equal and, as a result, I've unwittingly tested 16 GB offerings from Patriot, Kingston, and Wintec.  The Wintec and Kingston were just 'okay' (and the Patriot LX went back for being slower than a 8' floppy drive!) So I decided to do some additional searching and found a bunch of positive reviews for this card from Transcend.  Arrived today and immediately went into the camera for a low-level format, and then into the AJA System Test program (Mac) and wow!  This card is honestly accessible at over 20MB/sec (both read and write), making it almost twice as fast as the Wintec (and far ahead of the Kingston).  I'll need to shoot a card-full to see how it holds up in actual usage, but right now a second Transcend is on order and I think the Kingston will be heading back to the store.  If you're looking to record video on your Canon DSLR, look closely at this card from Transcend."

column607:
Short version: The card will fail on you and you will loose all your important photos.Long version: Had the card for a week. Used for all my Honeymoon photos in Hawaii and worked great. Left the following week for Switzerland for a week. Took all my photos on this card. Was reviewing them on my camera at work on monday morning and eveything was fine. Went to a meeting, then came back to download the card and it told me I needed to format it. Some research showed the card had somehow corrupted in the past hour and I needed to use a recovery program to get my photos. Downloaded the one form Transcend's website but when I tried to use it the card had gone from corrupted to unreadable. More research on the problem to find out the controller had failed. Only thing that can be done is send the card to a lab to have the flash memory chip removed and read. Turns out not to be a cheap operation. I got 3 different quotes which for this size card which ranged from $260 to $1200 depending upon how bad it was. $260 was the best I could hope for and $430 was more likely. Luckily I had already downloaded my Honeymoon photos. But the photos of me climbing the Matterhorn may stay forever lost because I can't bring myself to spend that kind of money. Good thing I don't climb for the photos.So maybe my card was a rare case but I wouldn't risk it. Look elsewhere for a new SD card."

column703:
I use this SD card for my lower end cameras, such as the Canon Rebel T2i, otherwise known as the 550D. Even though that camera supports SDXC memory cards, I didn't think I needed that much speed for this little camera, so I bought this memory card.Overall, the speed of this card is very nice. I notice that when copying files onto your computer, it can be a little slow, even with a high-end card reader, but it doesn't seem to bug me. While taking photos, This card saves it immediately. When I'm shooting RAW, I notice some lag after about three to four shots, which isn't excellent, but I don't shoot RAW all that often, so I don't mind. When shooting large JPEGs with this memory card (The camera I am using is 18 MP), I need to shoot about 30-40 pictures before it starts lagging, which is pretty nice, seeing the burst speed is only 3.7 fps on the camera I use. Also, beware that when this card starts to get full, the performance does slow down a bit, and sadly, the lag starts when this card gets to be about half full.For the videographers out there, this card works really well. This card is able to save 1080p video at 30fps with ISO all the way up at 6400 until the card is full. I find that really rare in a memory card, but it handles HD video really well. Whenever I take movies with this card, it never randomly stops recording because of lag.To sum this up, this is a nice and cheap card for the capacity and speed, and I find this card works very well. Of course, if your camera has an SD slot and you're using it for RAW photography, you will need to find a faster card, such as a Sandisk Extreme Pro SDHC card or an SDXC card, if your camera can support it. Otherwise, this is a great card for DSLRs and works great with point-and-shoot cameras as well, although for point-and-shoot cameras, this card is a bit overkill, unless you are shooting movies with it."

I recently received two SD 4GB Class 10 Transend cards. For the first time (I have used Transend cards in the past) the cards came without protective cases (they are often called jewel cases). These little cases are very helpful and I was surprised that they were not included.I called Amazon and spoke to a very helpful lady - she fully understood the value of having a case to protect and store the memory card. She acknowledged that a case was not furnished as it had been in the past. She immediately looked into the matter. First, she tried to call Transend but the number they provided Amazon did not work. Then she emailed them. Great service from her - a credit to Amazon.I am waiting for a response. I would not order any more Transend cards until I am sure that they will be delivered with a case.By the way, the little plastic memory card case which may be worth 10 cents - cost $2.00 with shipping - a ripoff.Best to buy another manufacters card - skip Transend"

column756: If you're pro it's a no-go.
column757:
I've had this card for a few months, but wanted to wait to leave a review until I knew full well how I thought about it.It is good value for the money IF you are not a wedding/birth or otherwise once in a lifetime event photographer. I do take a ton of pictures and since I shoot RAW+Jpeg (Canon) I find the 32gb really handy. However I've had problems with my card. This card errored out on me right before a wedding- I went ahead and ordered the 32gb Sandisk extreme III for $30 more than this card (on amazon) as a replacement, I didn't want to take the risk. Thankfully I am such a shutterbug that the pictures lost (if unrecovered) wouldn't have caused me any problems but had it been someone's life time event- no way.I now have something to compare this to and I can say the speed between the two cards is roughly the same but I can tell the plastic on the sandisk is better quality and I have never had a problem with any of my San Disk cards over the years (8gb and 16gb) it is always the off brands that cause problems. Are your memories or someone else's worth the risk to save like 30 bucks? I really don't think so.(just to note-I format my cards every time they do into the camera. I don't delete shots off the cards from my computer or in the camera to minimize risk) I really just think if I can- I'd like to warn anyone away from these cards- they seem great at first and like a great deal- but they are cheaply made(you get what you pay for) and unreliable."
20110713"
column759: I only use these and Lexar professional Cards
column760:
So I bought my first set of these about 6 months ago after hearing rave reviews about their CF cards. So i said lets give them a try. I now only use these and Lexar professional cards. Granted I havent bought a lexar in a long time because these trancend cards preform just as good for half the price. I currently own 12 of these with 2 more just purchased. They just do the job and last long. Ive tried them all , Kingston, San Disk, Lexar, Pro Spec, Pqi, even kodak and others. These def keep up with San Disk and Lexar for half the price and are completely better than all the other brands. Havent had one fail or break yet. Great Card!"
20110713"
column763:
I had one of these, for my Lumix camera and it came with a free usb reader.  First it did not work with my camera but it worked fine with my laptop, my desktop and my wife's laptop but not with the Panasonic Lumix camera.  The reader worked fine then one day I picked the card up and it came apart. The protective, plastic cover slide off like slided bread.  It was interesting seeing the inside mini board but useless at this point.  On closer inspection it appears the glue used to weld these things together had fail.  I got some super glue and tried to glue it back but the aread where you can apply glue is just too small and my efforts fail. In looking at the detail of this card I think it is not the quality you find with the name brand cards, I have never had a failure with a PNY and they are usually reasonably priced and also the Kingston -- that old saying, you get what you pay for.  I'm wondering, though, this may be a fluke as this card comes with a high user rating?  But after seeing, for myself, how flimsy these cards seem to be I would not take another chance on one. I don't feel too much of a loss as it was supposed to be for my camera and I'm glad it did not come apart in the camera, or better still, that it never worked with my camera so it was never used in the camera. I bought this 16GB card about two years ago and at a higher price than it is now selling for, so maybe they have improved?"
20110712"
column765: Excellent fast card for a great price!
column766:
Excellent fast card for both video recording and taking photos in RAW format on my T2i. I've used this one for about a month and an 8Gb of the same brand I bought several months earlier and they are both excellent. Can't beat the price!"
20110712"
column768: Does not work with a Kodak ZI8 HD Camera
column769:
I bought this card for my Kodak ZI8 and it worked for one session, and then the next time I used it the power button stayed lit in all red and the camera would not function unless I removed the battery to force it to power off.  If I removed the card the camera worked.  I used my backup card and noticed that the camera would 'flicker' when I used the zoom now. So I sent the camera into Kodak under warranty and they said they would replace it due to this issue:[KOD-ZI8-MB] - Main System Board Service for KODAK ZI8, BLACKSo this week I got my new refurb ZI8 and popped in the memory card and I got the same red light lit up on the power switch and had to pull the battery to turn the camera off.  Hoping this new camera doesn't 'flicker' again due to this poor quality card.  :("
20110712"
column772:
This card is fast it records video files up to 45mps on my Canon Rebel T2i. I have had it for a while and does a great job, very reliable. The only issue I have is the gold pins are starting to wear down, although card still works."
20110712"
column775:
This product is excellent for the money.  I have no problem using this with movies with my Canon S95 which requires a 10x speed care.  I may buy another one.Have a great day."
20110712"
column777: Exactly What I Was Looking For!
column778:
I have been looking for just the right SLR for myself and I finally found it.  This camera is light weight and even with the lens attached it's not much heavier.  I received this camera in two days after ordering.  If you're looking for a good, lightweight  slr this is the one you should buy and with the two lenses that come with the camera it's an unbelievable deal."
20110711"
column781:
I bought this card for my wife's new Sony NEX-3 camera. This camera is rated at 7 shots per second. I know it doesn't shoot that fast, but it shoots very fast. This card has been able to keep up with the camera very well. Occasionally after a series of shots, I will go to look at the pictures and the camera says it is writing to the memory card. I only have to wait 5 or so seconds for this message to disappear. This card is not as fast as the Sandisk card, but for the money and for a completely amateur application, this card cannot be beat."
20110711"
column784:
This SD card is fast and has a large storage capacity.  Unfortunately it only stores a majority of corrupted data.  I brought this SD card on my honeymoon to mexico and luckily I had a spare 4GB card to use, though I still lost a number of photos and videos that I cannot get back.This card randomly began corrupting images and videos.  Formatting the card lets it perform ok for a short number of shots, but then it begins corrupting again.  I would check the last one taken and it would be fine.  Then if I took another picture/video the previous one would become corrupted, repeat ad infinitum.  I could not retrieve any of them either, using many different types of recovery software.  It seems that the main corruption occurs in the file header of JPGs, but will erase the majority of the file content for video MTS files.Stay away from this card if you value your data!  There are many others on the market in this price range that will perform with adequate speed for HD video and that will not corrupt your precious files."
20110711"
column786: It's hard to go wrong for the price
column787:
I must admit that even though it's rated as class 10, this card is slower than my Panasonic class 10 card. If I put the camera on burst mode, the Transcend camera will pause for about a second after about 7 or so pictures to catch up writing the data to the card. The panasonic one goes on forever without ever slowing down or pausing. But the Panasonic card costs about $100 more.When using it to record full 1080p HD video, I saw now difference in performance between the Transcend and the Panasonic cards.So, for the price, you'd be hard pressed to find faults with this card if you know its slight limitations."
20110710"
column790:
You need a  class 6or higher so you can capture BETTER video with your Digital Camera. This will also enable to take more photos faster of the speed of the memory card"
20110709"
column793:
The 16 gb Sdhc card is excellent; it is fast and I have found the Transcend card an excellent buy. I also own the class 6 card as well."
20110708"
column796:
This card has performed flawlessly in my Canon S95 over the past month.  Both writing and download speeds are quick.  A fine product and great value."
20110708"
column799:
Like what most reviewers said, it worked like it should with a reasonable price. I use it with a P&S (Canon A3300IS) though the class 10 speed will definitely be more noticeable in DSLRs but I got the class 10 anyway so I won't have to worry about missing a shot because of slow write speed or suffer any performance hindrance when recording videos. Just a word of caution: I read that some cameras may not be able to handle memory cards with too high a speed and may even potentially damage it in some cases, but I gather it applies to mostly older models which do not have a fast enough camera processor to handle the high speed of the card or something like that.Something I've noticed about the card is when you press down lightly on the middle of it with your fingers, you could feel that it is a little soft, unlike the solid feel of both Kingston and SanDisk cards which I also own. However this does not affect or hinder the performance of this card in any way or give me cause to not recommend, it is only an observation. I have noted that after formatting the card in my A3300IS, the memory was only 15GB. Some people also have concerns about the temperature tolerance but I don't have such concerns where I live. I of course can't comment regarding it's longevity but I believe it would last me a good while yet. Ultimately, backed by a lifetime warranty with a reasonable price and good reviews, you can surely buy with ease!"
20110708"
column802:
I have it installed in my DeLorme PN-60 GPS and it works like a champ.  No problems at all."
20110708"
column805:
Great card for the price. SUPER fast transfer, about 8-10 minutes when full. Great capacity, 700+ shots (RAW+JPG) from a Nikon D7000.*Update, the card I bought stopped working completely, without notice, as of 01.23.2012. :/"
20110708"
column808:
It came fast, price was great. Works without hick-ups. 16GB will give you enough space for 4DVDs or one Blue Ray.Also, this works fine for video making and photography as well."
20110707"
column811:
Todo lo que se dice de este articulo es cierto. Vale la pena contar con una memoria de este tipo para obtener muchas fotos y a gran velocidad de grabado. Importante para ráfagas de fotos."
20110707"
column814:
I recently bought a Panasonic digital camera which is a 12 megapixel and does HDTV recording.  I was concerned that that high a resolution on pictures and video would need plenty of memory and I wanted a quick turn around between pictures so I went for the Class 10 card.  Price difference between lessor capacity cards and this was minimal and I have not been disappointed.  I can take what ever I want in pictures or video and not run out of space.  We went to Disneyworld with our grandchildren for over 10days and I shot plenty of pictures had loads of room left, turn around on the camera was quick.  This is a no brainer, get it.  My rating of the durability is anticipating good durability as I have had it for only 6 months at this point but I used a similar card in my previous camera and it was faultless for years."
20110706"
column817:
I'm using this memory card for ReadyBoost on Windows 7 and it has boosted some operating speed on an old laptop.  I was just looking for a cheap alternative to boost my loading times instead of purchasing an SSD.NOTE: this does not substitute for RAM."
20110705"
column819: Awesome,but think about what you are using it for
column820:
I used it in my camera. And I needed something with a little space for handling lots of pictures from time lapse photography. It holds about 2000 pictures. Which is A LOT for the average user, but if you are planning to use it for time-lapses that lasts longer than 2000 exposures, you.should be looking at one of these with a higher number on it"
20110705"
column822: Work perfectly on my brand new Sony HX100V
column823:
No complain at all.I Purchased two of them and they work perfectly on my Sony CyberShot HX100V."
20110705"
column826:
This card has, over the past three weeks, performed flawlessly with my Nikon D7000, which I have used to take and transfer both photos and 1080p video. I have used the card on the D7000's raw burst mode at an amusement park and little league game -- I never wanted to take more than about 5-8 photos in a burst and so I never had a problem with any lag in the processing. If you are taking bursts of a longer duration, you may want to get a faster card. Otherwise, imho this card is plenty capable of handling most people's burst needs.Slightly off topic, but as a sub-rating, I gave this card three stars for 'storage capacity' because it has a truly 'average' amount of capacity...as compared to other 32 GB cards. What a silly thing to rate -- two years ago, this capacity would have been thought gigantic, and two years from now, it will be small. There is a separate rating for 'value for money,' which takes into account the capacity vs. price. So I'm not sure why Amazon is asking reviewers to rate 'storage capacity' as an attribute. Anyone?"
20110705"
column829:
I have been using the card for a couple of weeks now without complaint. I used in a Sony Alpha a55 to record short videos and photos."
20110704"
column832:
Bought with my Canon 60D. I've shot a few hundred photos and a video or two, the longest being about 8 minutes or so. I haven't had any issues writing to the card.  There have been a few reviews I've read commenting about the poor performance when recording to video. For me it's a non-issue, as I bought my camera for photos. I figure If I want to record video, I'd get a camcorder. I've shot 8 shot burst of photos without problems.One complaint is that when I try to view pictures through the camera, it seems to be a little slow reading from the card. But I don't usually review my photos unless I want to get a quick idea of how my camera settings are working. I was able to insert the card and start using it without any issues. I feel confident enough in this product that I plan on purchasing another one before my vacation."
20110704"
column835:
This is a solid card for the money.  I use it with a Canon T1i.  it does great with photos and HD video."
20110704"
column838:
When I got this card, I was not able to save more than 40 GB on it, and it seemed that someone else had been using the card before I got it. This I could read from the history of the files in the card.Further, after 2 days of use, I could not delete the files or write more on the card, and can not reformat it.However, as I can still read my private files in the card in the locked position, and do not want to give my card back for replacement with my private data on it, I am left with a very expensive defect card."
20110704"
column841:
It works great for photos and videos on my D7000.  I have two and use one for pictures and one for video.  I gave it 4 stars for durability only because I haven't had it long enough to give it 5."
20110703"
column844:
I put it in my DSLR and I can now take pictures 3x as fast as my last class 4 sd card. the class 10 sd card is great for dslr cameras. if you are looking for a sd card for a camera i would recommend this in a heartbeat."
20110702"
column847:
I was a little worried about buying this product at first because the reviews were very mixed. I decided for the price it was worth taking a risk and am glad that I did.  I have been using this card in my Canon T3i for video 720p/60fps and it has no problem writing to the card. I got them because I needed something with a high writing speed and transfer speed.  I do a lot of time lapses with an intervolometer with the camera set to blub and if the camera has a hard time writing to the card it can sometimes skip 3 or pictures which are often the best shots.  These cards have worked perfectly.  I have also been using it with my Canon Vixia HFS200 and I have no complaints.  I am ready to buy a few more now!"
20110702"
column850:
I use this card with my Nikon D5000. The D5000's battery has about the correct capacity to let me fill up the 16 GB on this card, so that is a good pairing. I hate it, when I have to switch cards all the time ...Transfer speed is fast - without having measured this, my gut feeling tells me that it is about 30% faster than with the 8GB cards I used before.This card gives you a lot of bang for your buck."
20110702"
column853:
Easy to format with my HDC-TM900 video camera.  Holds plenty of video and still pictures captured with the camera.  Very fast and no issues."
20110702"
column856:
This little card enables me to take a couple of hours of HD video with my still camera.  Pop the card into a reader, and the videos download quickly to my computer."
20110702"
column859:
The memory cards works great and had good price. The only complaint I had was shipping was slower than I like."
20110701"
column862:
From the beginning, my camera (a Canon EOS) wouldn't always see the card until I would remove and reinsert it, sometimes twice (this hasn't happened with other cards, so it wasn't the camera).  Then, a couple days after I purchased it, on removing it from the camera the plastic casing came apart at the seam, which I'd never seen a memory card do before. I carefully glued it back together with a drop of superglue because it contained pictures I didn't want to lose, and it still worked, but I replaced it as soon as possible with a card of a different brand."
20110701"
column865:
Great card for the money.  Huge capacity (32 gigs equals about 7.1k large sized jpegs) and the Class 10 speed boost is huge over my old Class 6 in a Nikon D90.  Arrived quicker than expected as well."
20110630"
column867: Doesn't work well with Pentax K-x
column868:
I bought this card for a 2-wk vacation during which I took over 300 photos.  Thank goodness it held out and took all of those photos beautifully, though I did not notice any difference in transfer speed from my Class 4 card. I am just thankful it stored the photos safely until I loaded them onto my computer at home, because that was the one and only use of this card.  It never worked again.  It was not expensive, but I did expect to use it again and again.  Disappointed that I cannot.  I have since read other reviewers mention trouble using this card with the Pentax K-x.  Unfortunately those reviews were not up before my purchase.  This experience has soured me on Transcend products and I will not try another."
20110630"
column871:
It is a class 10, so it is fast to store and no need to wait for the next photo. This is a step up for me, so I am enjoying it."
20110630"
column874:
I decided to buy this card after my canon t21 was stolen with a 50$ class 10 card in it, and i have to say that this card is just as good as the $50 card hands down. the speed is awesome and keeps up. Defiantly a good buy."
20110630"
column877:
Can't say anything regarding reliability yet but its speeds are fine both with an external USB adapter and a built-in card reader of a netbook."
20110630"
column880:
I got this 8gb class card under $15, now I already used it for more than a month and it works perfectly.... no problem so far..."
20110630"
column883:
I have a new video camer that required a very large SD card and I had no idea they were so expensive. I shopped locally and was amazed at the prices, some being over $100. I finally settled on the Transcend 32G because it was a 'class 10'card and none of the local cards could come this close to the speed of this card or the price. I have used it only once and the performance was great. Fastest card I have ever owned and the quality thus far is outstanding."
20110630"
column885: lost pictures from this memory card!!!
column886:
i bought this memory card only a couple of weeks ago and the second time i used the memory card, the card went corrupt.  when i previewed the pictures on my camera, i got error messages 'unidentified image' with a yellow '?' and 'unidentified image' with the picture reduced to a much smaller size.  therefore, i tried to load the pictures to my PC then open the corrupt images with windows picture and fax viewer.  unfortunately, i got error message 'drawing failed.'  i searched on the internet and went through 5 - 6 different software that attempt to restore corrupt memory card images but to no avail.  i was able to open the picture with IRFANVIEW software, but a portion of the picture is grayed out (corrupt).  i contacted CANON to see whether it's an issue with the new CANON camera i bought the same time as the memory card.  they say that it's the memory card, and i should try formatting the card when i use it again next time - i had multiple SanDisk memory cards before, and never had to format them and never had any issues with corrupt images.  so conclusion is that this Transcend product isn't reliable.  Unfortunately, the images remain corrupt and are lost forever."
20110629"
column889:
I was looking for a large SD card. With this Transcend I have room to go back and forth between pictures and video and not worry about space.And this card is pretty fast writing to and downloading to the computer. The price I felt was good for this size card."
20110629"
column891: Transcend 8 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card  (Excellent Memory, Highly recomend)
column892:
This memory is super fast, I have to transfer files to a constant speed of 18 mbps, I recommend it widely, very useful for high-quality digital cameras especially for HD video recording (1080), best of all it is guaranteed for life against manufacturing defects and damage not caused by the user, definitely an excellent memory."
20110629"
column895:
Quick and fast transaction, the card is everything it was advertised to be and more. Every quick, me like. :)"
20110629"
column898:
So far I've purchased at least 6 of these cards.  For the money, the speed and reliability cannot be beat.  We use these in everything from our Nex-5 cameras, our Everio camcorders and our Zoom H41 recorder. They have yet to let us down, unlike some of the higher priced cards we have tried also.Because of the price, it's very easy to simply purchase new cards when needed.  That way, the data can be saved on the cards until the images are processed, backed-up and edited.  Makes worry of hard drive crashes or broken disks less terrifying.I can see buying more of these in the future as other film projects come our way.  They are perfectly priced for the small independent filmmaker and perfectly suited for our cameras and other equipment."
20110628"
column901:
Been using for a month - no problems. Been shooting 6mp photos and SD video. Will try HD when I get my camera. Good value for money. Too many over-priced cards out there."
20110628"
column903: Transcend 32 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card TS32GSDHC10E
column904:
I use this card in my AirStash drive, and as a result have unlimited additional storage for wireless use by my iPad/iPhone/iPod Touch or even with any of my computers, for that matter.  A recent firmware upgrade, to my AirStash drive, now permits me to use SDXC cards up to 2TB capacity size; however, until the cost of 64GB and higher capacity SDHC/SDXC cards become much more reasonable, i am going to stick with these Transcend 32 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card TS32GSDHC10E, purchased through Amazon Prime, as my far more cost effective alternative, to meet my mobile on-the-go wireless storage/use requirements with my iPad/iPhone or an iPod Touch."
20110628"
column907:
Purchased this card for my new Canon 60D. The card works fine so far, it is fast enough for full HD video @ 30fps and there's plenty of space."
20110627"
column910:
I purchasd this card to use with my new Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP DSLR (I know, a 'starter' camera). I don't record video, so I'm basing my impression on this card's ability to hold images at the highest resolution. Around 2800 images (JPG). Around 2600 (RAW format).So far, so good. Zero problems with speed or formatting. Had I known the capacity, I'd have purchased a smaller capacity card! (Though the price was right, and if I do decide to ever shoot video using my DSLR, I'm set...)"
20110627"
column912: very pleased aboaut this sdhc class 10 card
column913:
Well, I have to tell you that I am more then pleased with this excellent sdhc transcend card...I recommend those who want a reliable one...thanks"
20110627"
column916:
I don't know if anyone else has mentioned it or if it has happened to them personally, but this memory card deletes my pictures. It's a gamble to use, because sometimes it keeps the pictures and sometimes it doesn't. For some reason, it'll be there when I take the picture, but in the same day I can go back and the pictures will just vanish (5-50 pictures at a time). It's not the camera, because I switched memory cards and it never happened again. I just need to suck it up and pay for a better one with a lot of memory. Most people complain about speed when it comes to 16 gb and up memory cards, but mine actually deletes my pictures, which is a HUGE problem."
20110627"
column918: Product failed, Transcend refused to replace
column919:
I've purchased many memory cards over the years and this is the first one I've had fail so quickly.  I've only had it a few months, when my computer would no longer recognize it.  I returned it to Transcend as an RMA, but they refused to repair or replace it, saying that I opened the memory card.  The reality is that the card isn't very robust, which is perhaps what they mean by it being opened.  I will not be purchasing any Transcend products in the future if they are unwilling to stand behind their quality."
20110627"
column922:
I am always working on video productions and am very careful about the gear I use.In short, I have used Transcend twice and both times the cards got corrupted. I will never EVER use them again.The first time I was capturing footage on a 60D and when we went to upload the footage nothing could read the card. We tried multiple methods of getting the footage back but all the files were too corrupted. I lost very important footage.The second time was on a Panasonic HMC-150 and when I tried to upload the footage the camera could no longer read the card. Luckily, the card was able to be read with my Dynex card reader and I was able to get the footage off. Still, I'm not going to risk using these cards.I know some people love these cards but it's all based on numbers I guess. I just got very unlucky twice. However, with the stuff that I shoot I can't afford to take chances."
20110627"
column925:
I purchased the product because it was priced right. Worked forOne month fine then my camera started to freeze up.Sent it back. Lexar, PNY are the best."
20110626"
column928:
Don't let the low price scare you away.  These cards worked perfectly in all three of my cameras, Canon, Fuji, and GoPro, shooting both stills and video.  No problems whatsoever."
20110626"
column931:
I've had this card for a few weeks now and it has worked perfectly every time. I don't do video so I haven't fully tested the speed but it does feel a bit faster in my Nikon D40X."
20110623"
column934:
Good for the price of class 10 32 gb.....i thought it would b more than 10 mb/s......it doesnt impress me because it runs only at 11mb/s.....anyways....worth the moneyP/s: i used with my t2i camera.....it worked without problems"
20110623"
column937:
SUPER GREAT, ULTRA FANTASTIC! FAST SAVE, SO CHEAP!!!! I MEAN, I HAVE USED IT FOR MONTHSSSSS, AND NO ERRORS, NO PROBLEMS... NO REFORMATTING OF ANYTHING.. NOTHING ELSE TO SAY!!!!"
20110623"
column940:
Not much to say about this item, because they either work or don't work and this memory card most definitely works. I will purchase again from this company."
20110622"
column943:
Work perfect, thanks! I don't have any problem. This sd card functioning correctly in my camera Olympus Fe-47. The writing and reading velocity is good."
20110622"
column946:
This is an amazing deal for a top notch product. Only problem i noticed is that my card reader on my older computer doesn't read it. It's about 8 years old. But two other newer computers had no problems with it. Maybe because it's SDHC?Other than that it's reliable and fast, on top of being a great deal. At this poitn Transcend has become a reliable brand. A fe years ago i would've been doubtful about them since there were so many generic manufacturers, but i've had no problems. Other brands the cards would have read errors or images would not show on the image view on the camera."
20110622"
column949:
Every time I record HD video on my T2i, my camera stops recording prematurely because the card can't write data fast enough. Kind of sucks when you're shooting video at a wedding... or just a really cool drum cover. Bummer. Just spend more on a real mans card."
20110621"
column952:
Got this card for my sony cybershot dsc-hx100 camera. It writes even long videos to the card very quickly, i am very pleased with this purchase!"
20110621"
column955:
I was surprised this was so inexpensive and it worked great.  With my class 6 card I could get 15 or so pics in rapid fire before a delay, and with this I could just hold the shutter down and keep going until I stopped"
20110620"
column958:
This card worked well at first, but has been gradually deleting more and more photos right when I take them.  Camera and computer will say 'Unreadable.' SO disappointing.  Possibly because I have taken many photos, deleting some, then taking more without completely re-formatting the card.  That is not supposed to be a requirement, so I'm not too pleased with it.  Currently looking for a more reliable brand."

ES BASTANTE RAPIDA LA MEMORIA HASTA AHORA EXCELENTE Y TIENE UNA CAPACIDAD IMPRESIONANTE PARA CAMARAS DIGITALES COMPRE TAMBIEN UNA T3 CANON Y CON ELLA LA E USADO LA VERDAD ES MUY RAPIDA EN EL VIDEO NO HE TENIDO NINGUN PROBLEMA HASTA AHORATENGO UN AMIGO QUE COMPRO UNA CON INFERIOR VELOCIDAD HA 10X  Y ESTA EN PROBLEMAS CON SU CAMARA CUANDO TOMA VIDEO"

column963: Dont believe the less than 4 star reviews
column964:
There is absolutely no speed issue with this card that some of the other reviewers have written. Its faster and cheaper than other cards out there and works great. I would buy it again tomorrow."
20110620"
column967:
at first it could hold about 1000 photos.... Then after clearing out all the photos max capacity became 500, WHAT THE HECK?!?!?!?!?!"
20110620"
column970:
Bought this card with my new Canon XS and upon placing it inside the slot, I could not get it out. The card was too thick, or warped because the push to eject feature was not ejecting it, yet it worked with my 2 gig ScanDisk Ultra. I had to use needle nose pliers to remove it from my BRAND NEW camera. Pay a little more, and save yourself the aggravation from this horrible bargain card."
20110619"
column973:
I shopped around for a while but finally decided on this car.  I shoot a lot of HD videos for YouTube on my Canon T2i and needed a big card like this.  It's affordable, it stores a TON of minutes of HD video.  On the ticker at the bottom left it shows that 30 minutes are left of video to shoot but I've shot maybe 25min in a day and it kept fluctuating back between 30 and other numbers, not sure what that's about but sounds like an issue with the T2i more so than the card. I cant record on it, computer doesnt recognize it, camcorder doesnt recognize it, camera shows (ERROR), computer doesnt show anything (like card wasnt even there), camcorder shows (Please check your card). column979:

With 18 megapixels, set at the highest image quality, saving as both RAW and JPEG, this card still holds approximately 950 images.  While I don't plan on taking that many images without downloading, its nice to know I have that huge buffer if I need it.As far as speed goes, I haven't had the opportunity to really test it yet.  Set on RAW only, I had no issues with writing speed when shooting 8fps for short bursts (roughly 2 second bursts), so JPEG will be a no brainer.  However I have not shot bursts while recording in both RAW and JPEG, so I can't comment on that.What I can say is that I initially thought I may need to step up to an Extreme series SD card for writing speed, but as it stands now I think I'll be happy with these (I'm buying more) cards."

This is not a class 10 SD Card, despite what the company may say. I bought one to shoot video with my Canon T3i and it is constantly stopping my shoot. Not only did I waste $50 on it, but it was the only SD card I had with me at a show I was supposed to film last night, and it ruined the whole thing, constantly breaking up in the middle of songs. This morning I googled the problem and was startled to find several forums on film/camera sites full of people with the same issue. The common source of the video break up? This exact SD card. People buy it because it's cheaper, but it doesn't do what it claims. Spend the extra money and get a Sandisk or a Kingston. Read for yourself: [...]Don't buy!"

column1087:
The Sd Class standarized the specification for both memory and speed. The SD (Standard Capacity) has an official maximum 2GB-4GB, SDHC (High Capacity) 4GB-32GB, SDXC (Extended Capacity) 32GB-2TB. Cards from all SD families have a similar physical size excluding mini and micro SD. Some older device does not recognize card with bigger capacity which use larger blocks. Cards can be formated by many diffrent systems. Fragmentation may slow down the effective write speed. Defragmentary an SD card will wear the card out.All SD families must power-up at 3.3 volt and SDXC familiy can step down to 1.8 volt when reciving specific commands.Speed Class raiting is defined by the SD Association. Class reprezents a multiple of 1MB/s and meets write speed for card.The device such as video recording may not perform satisfactorily if the SD card's Class rating fall below a particular speed. Application for Speed Class; Class 2; MPEG-4, MPEG-2 video recording Class 4; MPEG-2 (HDTV) video recording and still camera Class 6; DSC photo-shooting, profesional videocamera Class 10; full HD, HD still picturesFor my cameras higher Class cards working good like Transcend 16 GB. I reccomend."

have bought several for cameras and cell phones.  This is the first one that went bad.  Went to Transcend's website, filed an RMA, sent them the bad one as instructed and received a replacement in about a week.  Better it didn't fail, but nice to know they honor thier warranty w/o hassles."

column1264:
I purchased this card from Amazon in mid April for a trip to Europe. Its high capacity made me more attracted to this particular product from Transcend.Regrettably at the one month mark the SD card seems dead, and I'm out $56.Repeated emails and inquiries to Transcend have gone unanswered.I've tried to format it using the PC: both with the official Transcend auto format tool; and Windows, and the camera - no luck. Transcend's website is no help, telling me to format the card. Then the only solution left is one telling me the card is incompatible, which it is not.It's upsetting to spend such a large amount of money on a small product to have it fail so quickly. Undoubtedly I don't recommended this product for your needs and based upon Transcend's support - any product from Transcend.So here I am in Spain, with an awesome camera... and no SD card.I've read that SD cards do occasionally die, but I didn't expect it to go so quickly."

column1267:
I wish I could review this product. I ordered it based on all of the positive feedback that I read here. However, Because of this new frustration free packaging there is a new frustration to be aware of. The packaging was so flimsy and poorly done that it arrived opened with no product in it. Now I am out of the money with nothing to show for it. Be safe with something this expensive, buy it locally. That way you actually receive it!"

This product performs well in my Kodak Play Sport at 1080p video recording.  Would highly recommend this memory card for the value and performance."
